title: Vacaville: Father shoots son in apparent gun accident
content:
A Vacaville man shot and injured his teenage son Thursday evening in an apparent accident while examining a gun, according to police.
The 15-year-old boy was shot in the abdomen with a small-caliber handgun shortly before 6 p.m. Thursday in the 200 block of Cedar Street, according to Sgt. Charlie Spruill.
The boy was taken to a hospital, where he is undergoing surgery and is listed in stable condition, Spruill said. His injuries are not considered life threatening and he is expected to make a full recovery.
The father appears to have been examining the gun, which was legally owned, to determine if it was in working order when it accidentally discharged, Spruill said.
No arrest has been made as of Thursday night. The father is cooperating with police and the shooting remains under investigation, Spruill said.
